question: Which one was the result of 44th Amendment of the Constitution?
option1: Right to property as no longer a Fundamental Right
option2: Suspension of individual liberty during emergency
option3: Barring the courts from interfering in the disputes regarding the election of Prime Minister
option4: Giving more importance to Directive Principles over Fundamental Rights
answer: Right to property as no longer a Fundamental Right
explanation: The 44th amendment act was passed in 1978 by the Morarji Desai government. Property ceased to be a fundamental right. It also said that right to property under article 31 of the Constitution is removed from the fundamental rights. It would, however, be given express recognition as a legal right. The provision being made that no person shall be deprived of his property.
